metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: SVG Fill Attributes
SVG Fill Attributes
The fill attribute sets the color of the inside of an element.
content.html: The fill attribute sets the color of the inside of an element.

content.text: Here we will look at the three fill attributes:
content.html: Here we will look at the three fill attributes:

content.text: SVG fill Attribute
The fill attribute defines the color of the inside of an element.
content.html: The fill attribute defines the color of the inside of an element.

content.text: The fill attribute can be used with the following SVG elements: <circle> , <ellipse> , <path> , <polygon> , <polyline> , <rect> , <text> , <textPath> , <tref> and <tspan> .
content.html: The fill attribute can be used with the following SVG elements: <circle>, <ellipse>, <path>, <polygon>, <polyline>, <rect>, <text>, <textPath>, <tref> and <tspan>.

content.text: The value of the fill attribute can be a color name, rgb value or a hex value.
content.html: The value of the fill attribute can be a color name, rgb value or a hex value.

content.text: Here we use the fill attribute for a polygon, rectangle, circle and a text:
content.html: Here we use the fill attribute for a polygon, rectangle, circle and a text:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg width="600" height="220" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<polygon points="50,10 0,190 100,190" fill="lime" />
  <rect 
width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" />
  <circle 
r="45" cx="350" cy="100" fill="red" />
  <text x="420" y="100" 
fill="red">I love SVG!</text>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg width="600" height="220" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <polygon points="50,10 0,190 100,190" fill="lime" />
  <rect width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" />
  <circle r="45" cx="350" cy="100" fill="red" />
  <text x="420" y="100" fill="red">I love SVG!</text>
</svg>

content.text: SVG fill-opacity Attribute
The fill-opacity attribute defines the opacity of the fill color.
content.html: The fill-opacity attribute defines the opacity of the fill color.

content.text: The fill-opacity attribute can be used with the following SVG elements: <circle> , <ellipse> , <path> , <polygon> , <polyline> , <rect> , <text> , <textPath> , <tref> and <tspan> .
content.html: The fill-opacity attribute can be used with the following SVG elements: <circle>, <ellipse>, <path>, <polygon>, <polyline>, <rect>, <text>, <textPath>, <tref> and <tspan>.

content.text: The value of the fill-opacity attribute goes from 0 to 1 (or 0% to 100%).
content.html: The value of the fill-opacity attribute goes from 0 to 1 (or 0% to 100%).

content.text: Here we use the fill-opacity attribute for a polygon, rectangle, circle and a text:
content.html: Here we use the fill-opacity attribute for a polygon, rectangle, circle and a text:

content.text: Here is the SVG code:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
  />

width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
  /

content.code:
<svg width="600" height="220" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<polygon points="50,10 0,190 100,190" fill="lime" fill-opacity="0.5" />
  
<rect width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
/>
  <circle r="45" cx="350" cy="100" fill="red" fill-opacity="0.6" />
  
<text x="420" y="100" fill="red" fill-opacity="70%">I love SVG!</text>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting.text:
<rect width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
  />

width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
  /

content.code_html:
<svg width="600" height="220" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <polygon points="50,10 0,190 100,190" fill="lime" fill-opacity="0.5" />
  <rect width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" />
  <circle r="45" cx="350" cy="100" fill="red" fill-opacity="0.6" />
  <text x="420" y="100" fill="red" fill-opacity="70%">I love SVG!</text>
</svg>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
<rect width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
  />

width="150" height="100" x="120" y="50" fill="blue" fill-opacity="50%" 
  /

content.text: SVG fill-rule Attribute
The fill-rule attribute defines the algorithm used to determine the inside part of a shape.
content.html: The fill-rule attribute defines the algorithm used to determine the inside part of a shape.

content.text: The fill-rule attribute can be used with the following SVG elements: <path> , <polygon> , <polyline> , <text> , <textPath> , <tref> and <tspan> .
content.html: The fill-rule attribute can be used with the following SVG elements: <path>, <polygon>, <polyline>, <text>, <textPath>, <tref> and <tspan>.

content.text: The value of the fill-rule attribute can be "nonzero" or "evenodd".
content.html: The value of the fill-rule attribute can be "nonzero" or "evenodd".

content.text: Here we use the fill-rule attribute for a polygon, with value "evenodd":
content.html: Here we use the fill-rule attribute for a polygon, with value "evenodd":

content.text: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg height="210" width="500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<polygon points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 160,198" fill="lime" fill-rule="evenodd" 
/>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg height="210" width="500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <polygon points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 160,198" fill="lime" fill-rule="evenodd" />
</svg>

content.text: Here we use the fill-rule attribute for a polygon, with value "nonzero":
content.html: Here we use the fill-rule attribute for a polygon, with value "nonzero":

content.text: Here is the SVG code:

content.code:
<svg height="210" width="500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<polygon points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 160,198" fill="lime" fill-rule="nonzero" 
/>
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg height="210" width="500" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <polygon points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 160,198" fill="lime" fill-rule="nonzero" />
</svg>
